verses.roman:
ity adri-go-dvija-makhaṁ
vāsudeva-pracoditāḥ
yathā vidhāya te gopā
saha-kṛṣṇā vrajaṁ yayuḥ

synonyms: iti—in this manner; adri—to Govardhana Hill; go—the cows; dvija—and the brāhmaṇas; makham—the great sacrifice; vāsudeva—by Lord Kṛṣṇa; pracoditāḥ—urged; yathā—properly; vidhāya—executing; te—they; gopāḥ—the cowherds; saha-kṛṣṇāḥ—together with Lord Kṛṣṇa; vrajam—to Vraja; yayuḥ—they went.
translation: The members of the cowherd community, having thus been inspired by Lord Vāsudeva to properly execute the sacrifice to Govardhana Hill, the cows and the brāhmaṇas, returned with Lord Kṛṣṇa to their village, Vraja.

purport.content: Although the Govardhana-pūjā was performed in a blissful and successful way, the matter was hardly finished. Lord Indra is, after all, tremendously powerful, and he received the news of the Govardhana sacrifice with burning anger. What ensued will be described in the following chapter.
